FowlerBricks,"2018-02-27T17:27:29.24Z","Lex Luthor Mech Takedown Unboxing Review","

Normal review format can get boring after awhile, don'
column2: t you think? I think so, which is why I&#39
column3: m going to do a little experiment. Today I have the Lex Luthor Mech Takedown before me, new and sealed so we&#39
column4: re going to do a sort of unboxing review. I&#39
column5: m itching to build this thing, so let&#39

column1: As I mentioned before, this set is sealed, so let&#39
column2: s go ahead and look at the box. The front is certainly eye catching. Looks like the Justice League, &nbsp
column3: or part of the Justice League, is facing off with Lex Luthor outside the Lexcorp tower. The Daily Planet gleams a block or so down the street. Lex hasn&#39
column4: t caused too much chaos yet, it seems. The road is gonna have to be paved again though. I like the color scheme and comic style background of the top left and bottom right corners of the box. The Justice League has a new group shot with their new outfits and Crypto.

column1: Moving over to the bottom left corner, we see...What is this? New Characters?? A new hero and a new villain? Well, this got exciting quick! Firestorm and Cheetah now join the DC Comics minifigure
column3: ll give them a closer look later once we crack the box open.

column1: It also looks like we get a new Batman, a new Wonder Woman and a new Lex! Let'
column3: awaits in top of the box. More character shots and an a close-up of the new Rebirth suit Batman! I really like the comic style explosion he&#39
column6: s standing in an explosion because you already know the answer: &quot

column1: Anyway, turning the box around, we find another action shot, some interesting features of the set: apparently I could attach the prison from the 76096: Superman and Crypto Team-Up to Lex'
column2: s Mech if I got it. And the Mech&#39
column3: s cockpit can fly. Like an escape pod. That&#39
column4: s cool and useful if Lex is losing the fight.

column1: As on the front of the box, all the exciting stuff is in the bottom left corner. Look at all those new pieces!
On the side is a neat bit of artwork with Batman and Wonder Woman.
Alright, enough talk about the box. I gotta open this thing! Got my knife ready...here we go!
Look at all the fun that awaits us here!

column2: s quite a few stickers, but man do they look good!

column1: The instructions are much the same as the box.

column2: s some cool stuff in the back. Who wouldn&#39
column3: t want a full page picture of Batman next to an iPhone?

column2: The instructions are telling me to build Lex and Batman, so let&#39
column3: s take a look at them.

column1: Batman is all decked out in his new Rebirth outfit. It looks a bit simple but I love it! It might be my #1 favorite Batman so far and that'
column3: I have like 18 Batman minifigures (all different and I&#39

column1: The gold belt looks amazing and I like the classic, almost 60s looking Batsymbol. He'
column2: s got a type 3 cowl, which is the newest kind, and the new face with stubble.

column1: He also has a neck bracket for attaching him to his rocket glider, so it seems like he doesn'

column3: t be Batman without a Batarang, so Lego has provided him with one plus an extra. Overall, very well done. I just wish there was a cape. Next up: Lex Luthor!

column2: t been able to get any Lex Luthor up until this point, so I&#39
column3: m very happy to be getting this one. I&#39
column4: m a huge fan of his Pacific Rim-esque armor. It&#39
column5: s so very well detailed, front and back. The purple on his torso seems almost sparkly, which is a bit odd. Lex&#39

column2: s no weapons for him yet, but he&#39
column3: ll get some later, according to the box. This the best battle ready Lex Luthor Lego has made yet. Now, moving on to the build. Here are the pieces we have to work with:&nbsp

column2: s some of the more notable ones:

column1: That black quarter circle! So awesome! The build starts out fairly simple. I think I'
Time to add some weapons and stickers.
Definitely the Bat-Glider. Lex would never use something like this...unless, off course, he had Batman captive and was trying to trick the other League Members. Two wings later and we'

column2: s an odd color for this set...aaannndd...we&#39
column4: This is the first time I&#39
column5: ve noticed that those throttle pieces come preassembled. This is a neat little thing. It&#39

column2: re left with a decent extras pile.

column1: Moving on to bag #2, things get more interesting: it'
column4: t know much about this character but it&#39
column5: s nice to see a new villain. Cheetah has two expressions: villainously happy or angry.

column3: s pretty neat anyway. Her tail is rubbery and is currently exclusive in this color. It is a slight bit lighter than her skin/fur or whatever she has. Fortunately it isn&#39
column4: t too noticeable. She comes equipped with a spear. She also has one of the three new Energy Infusers from this wave of DC sets. It consists of four pieces , including the highly useful 1x1 gold cylinder printed with the Lexcorp logo. Very well done Lego!

column1: Moving back to the build it seems we'
column3: s torso. Another funky colored piece. Weird.

column2: and a surprisingly complex build later, we&#39

column1: The legs come next. We get these parts in purple, which is pretty neat.
Those legs were a very interesting build. The stickers are pretty tough though. I got mine a bit lower than I would have liked, but it doesn'

column2: s our extras from this bag.
is the first thing we build. She&#39
column3: s the classic version, similar to the one from the&nbsp

column1: Unfortunately she has no arm printing or dual molded legs. The printing wraps around her legs nicely though and her skin tone matches her face and arms pretty good despite being printed on red.
While she does look very similar to the one from Superman Vs Power Armor Lex, she isn'
column2: t the same at all. She has all new prints and a new exclusive face.

column1: Her hair and lasso are the same as previous versions, Oddly, my set came with and extra lasso.
Overall, a nice minifigure but probably the least interesting for me. The next thing we'
column2: ll be building is the feet. The feet are nice and wide, allowing this mech to stand on it&#39
s take a look at what we have so far. We&#39

column1: The arms are next...ok, the upper arms are done.

column2: Finally we get to build Firestorm!

column1: He looks so awesome! Simpler design, bright colors, flaming head! He'
column2: s everything a good superhero should be and more. His head is made of some other type of plastic than usual, so it&#39
column3: s a slightly different color. The fire is molded to his head like Ghost Rider.

column1: The head plastic seems slightly lower quality, but not the flame itself. Firestorm still looks awesome though! Now we can take a closer look at the new flame pieces! Oooohh...two large flames, two small, two fist-on-fire pieces, two twirling fire streams, a small splat, as Jangbricks calls it and a large splat.

Lego did a good thing here with these pieces. I like them a lot. After we add some flame, 1x1 trans-orange studs with holes and the new 1x2 rounded plate to Firestorm and the large flames to the Bat-rocket-glider, it'
column2: s time to finish the mech.

column1: We have only to build the axe now. I love how this looks so far, except the hands look too small and Yoda-like. The stud shooter on top is great for play and the ball joint that it'
column2: s attached to makes it extremely hard for our heroes to find a blind spot on this thing. The back looks a tad plain, but those stabilizing thrusters or whatever they are help add some detail.

column1: And after we finish the massive Kryptonite axe
column3: re done! It looks great! It has amazing stability and excellent poseability.

column1: The stability is only occasionally compromised by the friction in the ankle joints. At least on mine, those joints are slightly loose, which can cause the mech to fall, but the feet are wide enough to mostly compensate and keep the mech upright.

column3: ve been sitting here writing this review for a couple hours now and since my Lego photography area is rather small, I&#39
column4: m beginning to get cramped, so let&#39

column1: For $40, the box feels rather small, but it&#39
column2: s actually a fair price, since the stuff you get actually could have been put in a box twice the size. Five minifigures, all currently exclusive, the Bat-rocket-glider and the mech for $40 is pretty good. Oh yeah, and the new flame pieces plus all these extras.

column1: For a side build, the Bat-rocket-glider is really well designed. I could see the Bat-rocket-glider, Batman and Cheetah being a small set. That'
column2: s how cool it is. The mech is a very welcome addition to my mech/brick built creatures collection. It&#39
column3: s also a huge improvement over the last Lex Luthor mech. It&#39
column4: s more bulky, has better color scheme and is generally more dangerous looking. The minifig selection is pretty much perfect.

column1: No arm printing or dual molding for Wonder Woman

column2: s another odd thing that isn&#39
column3: t really a con, but usually these Super Heroes sets come with a little comic book. This set didn&#39
column4: t come with one. Despite that, I would definitely recommend this set &nbsp
column5: to any Lego fan. Hopefully you enjoyed this review style.&nbsp

column2: t go. I forgot to mention that there are multiple places to attach Firestorm using power bursts to the mech and places to attach all the Energy Infusers, presumably to increase the mech&#39

This huge Lego
column3: is very cool. Ok one thing at a time!

column4: is great). You have Wonder Woman with her lazo&nbsp
column6: s her bracelets?), all-new Firestorm with a lot of pretty cool&nbsp
column8: with her simple spear (but very good details), Batman clad in grey&nbsp
column10: (looks like a glider to me if you reverse it) and of course, Luthor himself wearing his armour. My only criticism here is about lazy leg design (all plain colours except&nbsp
column11: for wonderwoman, and especially on lex and batman that made them look like wearing pajamas). Also, i&#39
column12: ve preferred to see a bulky armour&nbsp
column13: brick for lex (like the version for the junior set, to me is more comic-wise!) and i&#39
column15: big fan of the big bat-jetpack. While it&#39
column16: s not bad, i think we&#39
column17: ve seen too many of this, and this one is especially cumbersome and it gave me no Batman-feel in his design. But it&#39
column18: s just some minor complaint really, for playing around is just perfect, coupled with twin stud-shooters as well (also i like the transparent brick to easly&nbsp

column2: s mech is really big, it looks good and is really designed to play with. Articulations work&nbsp
column5: gun with 6 stud-shooters on top, jetpack-like turbines in the back(maybe for making big jumps or hover in the air),&nbsp
column7: cabin for lex to pilot it which became an escape pod with folding wings (also carrying two guns for&nbsp
column8: self-defence), awesome golden claws and a giant crazy kryptonite&nbsp
column10: s some clips to attach the three collectible energy infusers you find in this wave (here there&#39
column11: s the green one), and in the back there&#39
column13: s kriptonite prison, which is in not included. Really a lot of details on this big guy, and it&#39
column14: s also very stable (also actually cool stickers).

column2: s not love here? For a perfect price on retail you got great playability, a big green-violet Mech-Luthor&nbsp
column6: jetpack!! All Lego superheros sets should be like this one.
